CONJUGATES: Noun: scraps | Verb: scraps | scrapping | scrapped
ETYMOLOGY: From Old Norse skrap 'scraps, trifles', related to skrapa 'to scrape'. The verb is derived from the noun.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A small piece or amount of something, especially one that is left over after the greater part has been used.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She wrote a note on a tiny scrap of paper.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她在一张小纸片上写了张便条。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Discarded waste material, especially metal suitable for reprocessing.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The old car was sold for scrap.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这辆旧车被当废品卖掉了。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb, takes a direct object.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To get rid of something that is no longer useful or wanted; discard.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: They decided to scrap the old system and introduce a new one.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他们决定废弃旧系统，引入新系统。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He got into a scrap with the security guard.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Intransitive verb, does not take a direct object. Transitive verb, takes a direct object.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To engage in a brief fight or quarrel.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The kids were scrapping over the last cookie.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 孩子们为最后一块饼干争抢起来。

REGISTER: General, with some informal uses for meanings related to fighting.
